description: A three-ply cord fragment made from bark was spotted on a stone tool recovered at a cave in France.
title: 50,000-year-old string found at France Neanderthal site
title_page: 50,000-year-old string found at France Neanderthal site - BBC News
maintext: The study - whose lead author was Bruce Hardy of Kenyon College in Ohio - concluded that the production of the cord demonstrated that Neanderthals had a detailed ecological understanding of trees and how to transform them into entirely different functional substances.
